title: Stencil Font
content:
I'm looking for some good San Serif, Stencil fonts. I have a few, but I wanted some suguestions or sites where I can find some.

Thanks.
author: samiam1973

comments.content: Here are a couple you might find interesting -- [Pearson Stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/pearson-stencil-nf/) and [Matthews Modern Stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/matthews-modern-stencil-nf/) -- or not.

Marvellous ' [Jigsaw](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.typotheque.com/site/font_info.php?family_id=7&id=37)' _( Stencil )_, by [Johanna Balušíková](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.johanna.sk/) / [Typotheque](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.typotheque.com/), maybe.?

_( There even are stencil versions of ' [Eurostile](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=Eurostile+Stencil)', ' [Futura](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=Futura+Stencil)' and new ' [Paralucent](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=Paralucent+Stencil)'.. :)_

_Some more stencil type resources.:  
\> [www.stencilrevolution.com/resources/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.stencilrevolution.com/resources/)  
\> [hans.presto.tripod.com/fonts/stencil.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/hans.presto.tripod.com/fonts/stencil.html)  
\> [hans.presto.tripod.com/fonts/stencil2.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/hans.presto.tripod.com/fonts/stencil2.html)  
\> [cgm.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/stencil.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/cgm.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/stencil.html)_

One more, I would really like to mention.: Brandnew ' [Bunker](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.omine.net/bunker.htm)', by fellow Typophile [Eduardo Omine](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/typophile.com/node/12305) / [Omine Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.omine.net/)..

[Myfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=stencil&itemsperpage=100&resultcount=133&page=1) has 133 stencil fonts in their search. Check out in particular [Andrew-Andy](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ingrimayne/andrew-andy-stencil/) - it's really pretty.

Too bad I can't find the old Typophile Stencil thread. Here are a few:

[More stencil fonts at FontShop](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories=1&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=stencil)  
 [Cobra](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Categories/Graphic+Fonts/Cobra/) and [Kada](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Categories/Graphic+Fonts/Kada/) from Lineto

What about my InsiderStencil Regular Roman? It's the latest release of my Insider family.

[http://www.characters.nl/downloads/Insider2PDF.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.characters.nl/downloads/Insider2PDF.pdf "http://www.characters.nl/downloads/Insider2PDF.pdf")

Regards,  
®ené
Kada, yes. I remember that from a recent thread but couldn't dig it up. Thanks for resurrecting it, Stephen.

Re.: 'Kada'.: [This](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/70606.html) may be the most recent thread in which I mentioned 'Kada' _( April '05 )_..

_( And not to just 'bump' this thread, I would like to mention another fine stencil typeface.: ' [Looper](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.secretonix.pt/ftf/catalogue/BSlooper.htm)', by Mário Feliciano.. )_

A wonderful NEW stencilfont is Jigsaw Stencil by Johanna Balusíková (sorry, could not find the code for s with turnedround circumflexe...). To be found on

[www.typotheque.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.typotheque.com/ "www.typotheque.com")

Bert, Have you seen [my first reply to this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/typophile.com/node/12313#comment-71588).? :)

_( Edit.: And not to just senselessly ‘bump’ this thread, again, I noticed yesterday that there also is a new 'Compilation' out there, containing 40 selected stencil typefaces.: ‘ [stencilFONTS](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.apply.de/typefaces/stencilFONTS/start.htm)’, from [Apply](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.apply.de/).. )_

Don't forget the [FontFont Backstage](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=8&displayfontid=FF.11126.0.0&fontRendererText=Typophile) bundle: [FF Chernobyl](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.11126.1.5&attributes.sampleSize=144&sampleText=Typophile&sampleSize=96), [FF Container](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.11126.2.7&attributes.sampleSize=96&sampleText=Typophile&sampleSize=74) and [FF Watertower](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.11126.3.9&attributes.sampleSize=96&sampleText=Typophile&sampleSize=74). I found myself admiring these the other day.

Oh, and you gotta check out [Giant](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/giant/index.html) by [H&FJ](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/typophile.com/wiki/hoefler_frerejones). Be sure to check out their [More Examples](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/giant/more.html) pages. Since it's a [shaded](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/typophile.com/wiki/shaded) font, you actually get a [composed, background, and highlight](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/shades/features.html) version. Any one of them could stand on their own.

i dare to refer to my own attempt on a stencil font ...  
 [http://typophile.com/node/4933](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143217/http:/typophile.com/node/4933 "http://typophile.com/node/4933")
